BRANCH.COMMENT: if we need to filter or amend content, parse it into an IData document

INVOKE.NAME: true
INVOKE.COMMENT: parse the content, unless it was already parsed

BRANCH.COMMENT: if sender/receiver unchanged then throw an exception

Values.value: Illegal derivative: new document cannot be derived with the same sender and receiver as the original document
Illegal derivative: Trading Networks partner profile does not exist for the specified sender with the specified External ID: %$source/$derivative/type% = '%$source/$derivative/sender%'
Illegal derivative: Trading Networks partner profile does not exist for the specified sender with the specified Partner ID: '%$source/$derivative/sender%'
Illegal derivative: Trading Networks partner profile does not exist for the specified receiver with the specified External ID: %$source/$derivative/type% = '%$source/$derivative/receiver%'
Illegal derivative: Trading Networks partner profile does not exist for the specified receiver with the specified Partner ID: '%$source/$derivative/receiver%'
filter service temporarily disabled derivative rule
document already derived (the derived document "%$derivative/InternalID%" should be reprocessed directly)

BRANCH.COMMENT: derive the copy if rule is enabled

LOOP.COMMENT: copy each content part from source to derivative

INVOKE.COMMENT: if content was amended, use recognize to re-extract all the attributes

MAP.COMMENT: overwrite recognized values for doc ID, group ID, conversation ID, and doctype with source values; overwrite sender and receiver with target values

INVOKE.COMMENT: merge source attributes with recognized attributes (the latter take precedence)

SEQUENCE.NAME: $default
SEQUENCE.COMMENT: add custom attributes to target bizdoc

EXIT.NAME: $null
EXIT.FAILURE-MESSAGE: Default bizdoc content part does not exist: xmldata | ffdata | bytes

EXIT.NAME: $default
EXIT.FAILURE-MESSAGE: Specified bizdoc content part does not exist: %$part%

SEQUENCE.NAME: TN_parms
SEQUENCE.COMMENT: copy GroupID and ConversationID from source bizdoc, if not specified

SEQUENCE.NAME: $default
SEQUENCE.COMMENT: log reason why derivative was ignored
